verses.verse: The king's heart <S%H3820><s%> is [like] channels <S%H6388><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%> in the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Lord; <S%H3068><s%> He turns <S%H5186><s%> it wherever <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> He wishes. <S%H2654><s%>
Every <S%H3605><s%> man's way <S%H1870><s%> is right <S%H3477><s%> in his own eyes, <S%H5869><s%> But the Lord <S%H3068><s%> weighs <S%H8505><s%> the hearts. <S%H3820><s%>
To do <S%H6213><s%> righteousness <S%H6666><s%> and justice <S%H4941><s%> Is desired <S%H977><s%> by the Lord <S%H3068><s%> rather <S%H4480><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> sacrifice. <S%H2077><s%>
Haughty <S%H7312><s%> eyes <S%H5869><s%> and a proud <S%H7342><s%> heart, <S%H3820><s%> The lamp <S%H9327><s%> of the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> is sin. <S%H9128><s%>

The plans <S%H4284><s%> of the diligent <S%H9167><s%> [lead] surely <S%H389><s%> to advantage, <S%H4195><s%> But everyone <S%H3605><s%> who is hasty <S%H213><s%> [comes] surely <S%H389><s%> to poverty. <S%H4270><s%>
The getting <S%H6467><s%> of treasures <S%H214><s%> by a lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> Is a fleeting <S%H5086><s%> vapor, <S%H1892><s%> the pursuit <S%H1245><s%> of death. <S%H4194><s%>

The violence <S%H7701><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> will drag <S%H1641><s%> them away, <S%H1641><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> they refuse <S%H3985><s%> to act <S%H6213><s%> with justice. <S%H4941><s%>
The way <S%H1870><s%> of a guilty <S%H2054><s%> man <S%H376><s%> is crooked, <S%H2019><s%> But as for the pure, <S%H2134><s%> his conduct <S%H6467><s%> is upright. <S%H3477><s%>

It is better <S%H2896><s%> to live <S%H3427><s%> in a corner <S%H6438><s%> of a roof, <S%H1406><s%> Than <S%H4480><s%> in a house <S%H1004><s%> shared <S%H2267><s%> with a contentious <S%H4066><s%> woman. <S%H802><s%>

The soul <S%H5315><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> desires <S%H183><s%> evil; <S%H9563><s%> His neighbor <S%H7453><s%> finds <S%H2603><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> favor <S%H2603><s%> in his eyes. <S%H5869><s%>

When the scoffer <S%H9238><s%> is punished, <S%H6064><s%> the naive <S%H6612><s%> becomes <S%H2449><s%> wise; <S%H7919><s%> But when the wise <S%H2449><s%> is instructed, <S%H7919><s%> he receives <S%H3947><s%> knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>
The righteous <S%H6662><s%> one <S%H6662><s%> considers <S%H7919><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> of the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> Turning <S%H5557><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> to ruin. <S%H9563><s%>
He who shuts <S%H331><s%> his ear <S%H241><s%> to the cry <S%H2201><s%> of the poor <S%H1800><s%> Will also <S%H1571><s%> cry <S%H7121><s%> himself <S%H1931><s%> and not be answered. <S%H6030><s%>
A gift <S%H4976><s%> in secret <S%H5643><s%> subdues <S%H3711><s%> anger, <S%H639><s%> And a bribe <S%H7810><s%> in the bosom, <S%H2436><s%> strong <S%H5794><s%> wrath. <S%H2534><s%>
The execution <S%H6213><s%> of justice <S%H4941><s%> is joy <S%H8057><s%> for the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> But is terror <S%H4288><s%> to the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity. <S%H205><s%>
A man <S%H120><s%> who wanders <S%H8582><s%> from the way <S%H1870><s%> of understanding <S%H7919><s%> Will rest <S%H5117><s%> in the assembly <S%H6951><s%> of the dead. <S%H7496><s%>

He who loves <S%H157><s%> pleasure <S%H8057><s%> [will become <S%H6238><s%>] a poor <S%H4270><s%> man; <S%H376><s%> He who loves <S%H157><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%> and oil <S%H8081><s%> will not become rich. <S%H6238><s%>
The wicked <S%H7563><s%> is a ransom <S%H3724><s%> for the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> And the treacherous <S%H898><s%> is in the place <S%H8478><s%> of the upright. <S%H3477><s%>
It is better <S%H2896><s%> to live <S%H3427><s%> in a desert <S%H4057><s%> land, <S%H776><s%> Than <S%H4480><s%> with a contentious <S%H4066><s%> and vexing <S%H3708><s%> woman. <S%H802><s%>

There is precious <S%H2530><s%> treasure <S%H214><s%> and oil <S%H8081><s%> in the dwelling <S%H5116><s%> of the wise, <S%H2450><s%> But a foolish <S%H3684><s%> man <S%H120><s%> swallows <S%H1104><s%> it up.
He who pursues <S%H7291><s%> righteousness <S%H6666><s%> and loyalty <S%H2617><s%> Finds <S%H4672><s%> life, <S%H9132><s%> righteousness <S%H6666><s%> and honor. <S%H9202><s%>

A wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H2450><s%> scales <S%H5927><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> of the mighty, <S%H1368><s%> And brings <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> the stronghold <S%H5797><s%> in which <S%H4009><s%> they trust. <S%H4009><s%>
He who guards <S%H8104><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%> and his tongue, <S%H3956><s%> Guards <S%H8104><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from troubles. <S%H6869><s%>
"Proud, <S%H2086><s%>" "Haughty, <S%H3093><s%>" "Scoffer, <S%H9238><s%>" are his names, <S%H8034><s%> Who acts <S%H6213><s%> with insolent <S%H2087><s%> pride. <S%H2087><s%>
The desire <S%H8378><s%> of the sluggard <S%H6102><s%> puts <S%H4191><s%> him to death, <S%H4191><s%> For his hands <S%H3027><s%> refuse <S%H3985><s%> to work; <S%H6213><s%>
All <S%H3605><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> long he is craving, <S%H183><s%> While the righteous <S%H6662><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> and does not hold <S%H2820><s%> back. <S%H2820><s%>

The sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is an abomination, <S%H8441><s%> How <S%H637><s%> much <S%H637><s%> <S%H3588><s%> more <S%H637><s%> <S%H3588><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> he brings <S%H935><s%> it with evil <S%H2154><s%> intent! <S%H2154><s%>
A false <S%H3577><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> will perish, But the man <S%H6><s%> who listens <S%H376><s%> [to the truth] will speak <S%H8085><s%> forever. <S%H1696><s%>

A wicked <S%H7563><s%> man <S%H376><s%> shows <S%H5810><s%> a bold <S%H5810><s%> face, <S%H6440><s%> But as for the upright, <S%H3477><s%> he makes <S%H3559><s%> his way <S%H1870><s%> sure. <S%H3559><s%>
There <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and no <S%H369><s%> understanding <S%H8394><s%> And no <S%H369><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%> against <S%H5048><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>
The horse <S%H5483><s%> is prepared <S%H3559><s%> for the day <S%H3117><s%> of battle, <S%H4421><s%> But victory <S%H8668><s%> belongs to the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>
